revised_title: Catalysis of H2-D2 Exchange by Oxides: Influence of Electronic Configuration
tldr: The authors investigated the catalytic activity of 13 oxides in the H2-D2 exchange reaction, finding a correlation between the electronic configuration of the metal ion and the catalytic activity. Oxides with a suitable number of impaired d-electrons exhibited high activity, while those with no unpaired d-electrons or too many had low activity. The results suggest that hydrogen behaves similarly at metal and oxide surfaces, providing a common motif for catalysis by these solids.
